oai_dc:dc.dc:title: P-31 NMR study of the spin S=1/2 quasi-1D Heisenberg antiferromagnet BaCuP2O7
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHAJAN, AV
NATH, R
BUTTGEN, N
KEGLER, C
LOIDL, A
BOBROFF, J
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: chains
one-dimensional
heisenberg antiferromagnet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present bulk susceptibility and P-31 NMR measurements for BaCuP2O7. The data above 1 K are in good agreement with the S = 1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnetic chain model with an intra-chain exchange constant J/k(B) = 108 K. Clear anomalies are observed at 0.85 K in the temperature dependence of the 31 P NMR shift, spin-lattice relaxation rate, and the spectra signifying the onset of some type of long-range order. The shape of the NMR spectra below 0.85 K Suggest the occurrence of incommensurate order. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
